name: abies-alba
light: Full sun (6 or more hours of direct sunlight a day)
Partial Shade (Direct sunlight only part of the day, 2-6 hours)
fruit-description: No fruits. This plant has erect cones which are 4–7 inches long 1–2 inches wide with 100–200 scales containing two, winged seeds. Cones start out bronze-green and disintegrate as they turn dark brown at maturity.
leaf-description: This plant has leaves that are needle-like, flattened 0.8 to 1 inch long, and 0.8 inch wide with a notch at the tip. Needles are spaced regularly along branches in two groups pointing toward the branch tip. There are two longitudinal stripes on the underside. Needles appear white or silver when viewed from afar.
bark-description: The bark is dark gray and smooth with resin blisters and square plates when mature. The stems are scaly though.
stem-description: The mature stems are gray with a scaly texture. The older stems are brown and rough. Twigs are pubescent.
uses: Lumber used for construction and furniture.
